today_in_history_posts.title: BIP 151 use of HMAC_SHA512
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- SHA256's length extension property makes it insecure for MAC, prompting discussion.
- HMAC is favored for its proven security properties, even with weak hashing functions.
- Despite SHA256's robustness in Bitcoin, a MAC is deemed unnecessary in this context.

today_in_history_posts.title: [BOLT Draft] Onion Routing Spec
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Rusty Russell proposes merging "header" and "per-hop payload" into one 40-byte field.
- Adding a "realm" byte is suggested for future protocol extensions with backward compatibility.
- Russell recommends truncating the seen log and changing replay protection for efficiency.

today_in_history_posts.title: bLIP: BOLT 11 Invoice Blinded Path Tagged Field
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The proposal introduces a new BOLT 11 field for better privacy in lightning payments.
- It ensures backward compatibility and sets a foundation for future protocol upgrades.
- Focuses on technical specifications, operational considerations, and invites community feedback.
